name: 楊勝明
objective: Brushless dc and permanent-magnet synchronous motor have higher efficiency and energy to mass ratio in comparison to the other motors. They are gradually replacing induction motor and widely used in industry. This course begins with the theory of basic electromagnetic energy conversion, followed by the modeling and vector control theory for permanent-magnet synchronous motor, design and control of brushless dc motors, and the driving circuit design for these motors. Finally, sensorless PM machine control techniques are introduced.
schedule:
1. Electromagnetic energy conversion (Chapter 1)
2. PM and magnetic circuit (Chapter 1)
3. BLDC basics (Chapter 2)
4. BLDC basics (Chapter 2)
5. BLDC drive and control (Chapter 3)
6. Complex vector transformation (Chapter 4)
7. PMSM mathematical model (Chapter 4)
8. Vector control, current control (Chapter 5)
9. Mid-term exam
10. Field-weakening, position and speed (Chapter 5)
11. Sinusoidal and space vector PWM (Chapter 6)
12. Neutral voltage and blanking-time (Chapter 6)
13. Implementation of the control system (Chapter 7)
14. Parameter measurements (Chapter 7)
15. Model-based sensorless vector control (Chapter 8)
16. HFVI-based sensorless vector control (Chapter 9)
17. Direct torque control (Chapter 10)
18. Final exam
scorePolicy:
Home works: 20%
Mid-term exam: 40%
Final exam: 40%
